api/CG.Email.HostBuilderExtensions.html.keywords: Class HostBuilderExtensions This class contains extension methods related to the Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder type. Inheritance System.Object HostBuilderExtensions Inherited Members System.Object.Equals(System.Object) System.Object.Equals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.GetHashCode() System.Object.GetType() System.Object.MemberwiseClone() System.Object.ReferenceEquals(System.Object, System.Object) System.Object.ToString() Namespace : CG.Email Assembly : CG.Email.dll Syntax public static class HostBuilderExtensions Methods AddEmail(IHostBuilder) This method adds a standard email service to the specified host builder. Declaration public static IHostBuilder AddEmail(this IHostBuilder hostBuilder) Parameters Type Name Description Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder hostBuilder The host builder to use for the operation. Returns Type Description Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.IHostBuilder The value of the hostBuilder parameter, for chaining calls together. Remarks The idea with this method, is to create a quick and easy way to setup email services for a hosted application by following a simple configuration convention. That convention assumes a configuration section exists like this: { "Services" : { "Email": { "Strategy" : "Smtp", "Assembly" : "", "Smtp": { "ServerAddress": "localhost", "ServerPort": 25, "UserName": "me@mine.biz", "Password": "locally encrypted password" } } } } Let's break it down. The Services section is where ALL services for the application should be configured. If you're adding a CodeGator service to your application then you'll want to add that service to this section in order to configure the service at startup. Under Services , the Email section is where the CodeGator email service should be configured. This section contains at least two nodes: Strategy and Assembly . The Strategy node tells the host what strategy to load for the email service, and as such, is required. The Assembly section is options, and is only needed when the strategy is located in an external assembly that should be dynamically loaded at startup. The Smtp section is an example of a strategy section. This will vary, of course, depending on which strategy is named in the Strategy node. In this case, we see a made up example for an SMTP email strategy. One thing to note is, the Smtp strategy expects a locally encrypted value in the Password node. Placing unencrypted text here will cause a runtime error. To locally encrypt for configuration, consider using the QuickCrypt tool, which is free, open source, and is located here: https://github.com/CodeGator/CG.Tools.QuickCrypto Exceptions Type Condition System.ArgumentException This exception is thrown whenever one or more of the required parameters is missing or invalid.
